casebody.data:
BRATTON v. TROJAN BOAT COMPANY Submitted June 8,1971. (No. 3

June Term 1971,

Docket No. 52,680.) Decided June 24, 1971. Opinion filed August 27, 1971. Raymond L. Krell, for plaintiffs. Sugar, Schwartz, Silver, Schwartz & Tyler, for defendant. Per Curiam.

For the reasons set forth in Buscaino v. Rhodes (1971), 385 Mich 474, released today, we hold that by filing his complaint within three *586years from the date of injury the plaintiff here complied with the statute of limitations.

The Court of Appeals is affirmed.

Appellee may tax costs.

T. M. Kavanagh, C. J., and Black, Adams, T. E. Brennan, T. G. Kavanagh, Swainson, and Williams, JJ., concurred.
